mlr3mbspls 0.2.11

Filter observations by target label(s)

Source: R/PipeOpTargetLabelFilter.R
PipeOpTargetLabelFilter.Rd

PipeOpTargetLabelFilter filters the input Task by its target column and forwards the filtered Task. It is a dedicated, composable row filter that replaces ad-hoc filtering inside other PipeOps.

By default, filtering is applied during training. During prediction, if the target column is not present (typical for newdata), the operator becomes a no-op and passes the task through unchanged.

Value

A PipeOpTargetLabelFilter.

Details

Target-Label Filter

After filtering, if the target is a factor:

  • For invert = FALSE the target's level set is the union of labels with their original order preserved (unobserved labels are allowed).

  • For invert = TRUE the target's level set is setdiff(original_levels, labels).

  • If this level set has fewer than two levels, it is padded with additional level(s) from the original levels (as needed) so that length(levels(target)) >= 2.

Some learners still require two observed classes in the training data; this PipeOp only guarantees the metadata (level set), not the label balance.

Parameters

Hyperparameters are defined in the object's param_set and can be set via param_vals.

See also

Other PipeOps: PipeOpMBsPLS, PipeOpSiteCorrection
